column4: My media player sais it can't decode an mpeg stream. That can't be right. Do I need some extra libs or something?
totem-xine it is. thanks for the hint.
zugot: noted. totem-xine doesn't seem to exist for 64 yet...
yes it does
it does? do I have to add something to apt to find it?
it might be in universe...
Sorry. I don't know what "universe" is. Can you give a link so I can read up on it?
it is a configuration option in synaptic, or you can edit sources.list
Thanks. Amazing what a little info can do.
yep :) so far I've only found one avi that doesn't play under amd64... I assume I just need some other codec, but I can play divx, wmv, mov, dvd, etc
Since you're so good at this. Do you happen to know what package to install to get the sound to work too?
sound for what?
I have no sound at all.
:/ sound worked out of the box for me.  what sort of sound card do you have?
audigy2. thought perhaps the alsamixer might help but it hasn't so far. I can hear the speakers "tap" when alsa is started but once logged in I have no sound.
and it seems during boot that the audigy2 is detected?  I'd expect that to work in amd64...
have you checked all the tabs in alsamixer?  It seems that it should work OK
in particular, it seems "Audigy Analog/Digital Output Jack" might need to be disabled.
analog output jack is disabled. what am I looking for in dmesg? is audigy tagged as something else perhaps?
all tabs in alsamixer. That's quite a lot... ;-)
heh, that's just what I've heard.  I don't have an audigy2, as this is an amd64 laptop
